title: 'One week after Trump's election, a new alignment is emerging in Europe'
summary: Faced with the prospect of a settlement of the war in Ukraine from which they could be excluded, some European countries, such as Poland, are taking action, writes Le Monde's Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Special counsel Smith asks court to pause appeal seeking to revive Trump's classified documents case
summary: Jack Smith’s team has been evaluating how to wind down the classified documents and the federal 2020 election interference case in Washington before Trump takes office because of longstanding Justice Department policy that says sitting presidents cannot be prosecuted.

title: Trump picks Matt Gaetz for attorney general, Marco Rubio for secretary of state
summary: Gaetz, 42, represents much of the Florida Panhandle and became a conservative star when he joined Congress, appearing as a frequent staunch defender of Trump on cable news. Rubio, 53, is a noted hawk on China, Cuba and Iran, and was a finalist to be Trump's running mate on the Republican ticket last summer.

title: COP29: Africa sees itself as the hub of the future global market in pollution rights
summary: Some 10 countries have already signed agreements with industrialized nations before the outcome of the UN climate negotiations.

title: Azerbaijan President Aliyev blasts France for reaction to New Caledonia protests
summary: President Ilham Aliyev alleged that France's handling of protests in the French overseas territory of New Caledonia, in May, constituted 'crimes' and 'human rights violations.' France has previously accused Azerbaijan of foreign interference in the island's protests.

title: Far-right fake jobs trial: French prosecutors request Marine Le Pen be banned from election to office
summary: In a trial for charges of embezzling EU Parliament funds in a fake jobs scheme, the prosecution requested that far-right leader Marine Le Pen be banned from being elected to public office, which would bar her from running for the presidency in 2027.

title: Biden hosts Trump at White House to begin transfer of power
summary: Back in Washington for the first time since his election victory, Donald Trump thanked President Joe Biden for pledging a smooth transfer of power after receiving a standing ovation from House Republicans.

title: Six Israeli soldiers killed during combat on the ground in Lebanon
summary: The soldiers 'fell during combat in southern Lebanon,' the army said in a statement. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on X shared an image of the 'Golani' Brigade symbol – the unit the soldiers killed belonged to – a green olive tree against a yellow background, with a broken heart emoji.

title: Speaker Mike Johnson wins GOP nomination to remain in job, faces full House vote in new year
summary: Johnson has embraced Trump's priorities mass deportations, tax cuts, gutting the federal workforce and a more muscular US image abroad. As Johnson tells it, the President-elect is the 'coach' and he is the 'quarterback' as they prepare for a unified Republican government in the new year.

title: Azerbaijan President Aliyev blasts France for reaction to New Caledonia protests
summary: President Ilham Aliyev alleged that France's handling of protests in the French overseas territory of New Caledonia, in May, constituted 'crimes' and 'human rights violations.' France has previously accused Azerbaijan of foreign interference in the island's protests.

title: France opposed to Mercosur deal EU Commission hopes to sign
summary: Ursula von der Leyen is confident a trade agreement with the South American countries can be reached. The EU Commission president is due to meet Prime Minister Michel Barnier on Wednesday.

title: War in Sudan: The invisible battle against hunger
summary: 'In Sudan, a total war' (3/8). According to the United Nations, at least 26 million Sudanese, more than half of the population, are acutely undernourished, including 8.5 million in critical condition.

title: Spain goes on red alert for further torrential rain two weeks after deadly floods
summary: Schools will be closed on Wednesay after the national weather agency placed parts of Valencia on red alert on Wednesday night, as well as Catalonia in the northeast and Malaga in the southeast.

title: In Brazil, the EU-Mercosur trade agreement no longer generates as much enthusiasm
summary: The share of Brazilian agribusiness sector exports sent to European Union countries fell  from 40.9% to 13.3% between 1999 and 2024, notably in favor of China, which now accounts for 32.6% of exports.

title: Musk commissioned by Trump to 'dismantle government bureaucracy'
summary: The X, Tesla and SpaceX boss has been appointed, along with former Republican primary candidate Vivek Ramaswamy, to head a new 'Department of Government Efficiency,' whose focus should be on deregulation.

title: School principal recounts 'fatwa' that led to beheading of French teacher
summary: Audrey F. documented every event during the 10 days that led to the killing of Samuel Paty in October 2020. She is also one of the few witnesses to have met the two men who falsely accused the teacher.

title: Trump appointments confirm desire to break with the past
summary: The president-elect is shaping a team chosen for their loyalty and radically pro-Israel line. Pete Hegseth, a Fox News presenter, will be Secretary of Defense and Mike Huckabee, popular with evangelicals, will be ambassador to Israel.

title: Le Pen's no. 2, gradually taking liberties, relishes in his authority
summary: As chairman of Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National party, Jordan Bardella is cautiously asserting his independence from the three-time presidential candidate.

title: Republican Ken Calvert wins reelection to US House in California's 41st Congressional District, Democrat Dave Min wins in the state's 47th
summary: Now elected to a 17th term, Calvert remains the longest-serving Republican in the California congressional delegation. The 47th Congressional District southeast of Los Angeles, which includes Huntington Beach, was a top target for national Republicans looking to protect and possibly expand their narrow majority

title: Pennsylvania Senate contest headed toward a recount
summary: The Associated Press called the race for Republican David McCormick last week. As of Wednesday, McCormick led Democratic incumbent Sen. Bob Casey by about 28,000 votes out of more than 6.9 million ballots counted – inside the 0.5% margin threshold to trigger an automatic statewide recount under Pennsylvania law.

title: In China, authorities put an end to Henan students' late-night bike rides
summary: For several months, more and more young people in Zhengzhou had been using bikeshare bikes to cycle to a nearby city some 50 kilometers away. The scale of this phenomenon, though apolitical, prompted authorities to ban it.

title: Protests erupt in Paris over controversial gala in support of Israel
summary: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich had been expected to attend Wednesday's gala, dubbed 'Israel is Forever,' which was planned by an association of the same name. After days of growing criticism of the event, Smotrich's office confirmed Wednesday that the minister would not travel to Paris to participate.

title: Man with explosives dies trying to enter Brazil Supreme Court
summary: The incident occurred ahead of a G20 summit taking place next Monday and Tuesday in Rio de Janeiro that will gather leaders from around the world.

title: Republicans win 218 US House seats, giving Donald Trump and the party control of government
summary: Trump has promised to carry out the country’s largest-ever deportation operation, extend tax breaks and reshape the US economy.

title: India, the world's most populous country, asks women in its southern states to have more children
summary: Although more developed, the southern regions of the sub-continent are experiencing a steady decline in fertility, a concern for their leaders in terms of their future political representation in parliament.

title: 'No Other Land': A shared Palestinian and Israeli view of West Bank colonization
summary: In this documentary, a young activist from Massafer Yatta chronicles the local farmers' stubborn resistance after having been declared illegal on their own land by Israel, since the 1980s.

title: French government caught up by social unrest
summary: The growing number of redundancy plans is worrying the government, which is meanwhile adopting budgetary measures.

title: Israeli bombardment threatens Lebanon's architectural heritage
summary: In Baalbek, strikes hit the immediate vicinity of rich Roman remains and damaged churches. Other ancient sites in Tyre and Byblos are under threat. UNESCO's Special Committee for the Protection of Cultural Property in the Event of Armed Conflict will hold a special session devoted to Lebanon on November 18.

title: Head in the stars: Five astronomy activities for families around Paris
summary: Discovering the solar system and the Milky Way is an exciting experience for children. A number of sites offer fun and exciting tours, enabling parents to deepen their knowledge of astronomy and space exploration too.

title: French-made weapons used in Sudan 'in violation of UN embargo,' reports Amnesty
summary: Amnesty International says French-made weaponry, supplied by the UAE, is being used in Sudan's civil war that has intensified in recent weeks.

title: Kaja Kallas tells MEPs she will support EU aid to Ukraine until 'victory'
summary: Speaking before members of the European Parliament, the European Union's new high representative for foreign affairs put forward a slightly different vision from the one held by her predecessor, Josep Borrell.

title: Trump marks returns to Washington with polite White House visit and controversial nominations
summary: On Wednesday, Joe Biden hosted the president-elect in an exchange described as 'cordial' by the Democrat. Shortly afterward, Donald Trump appointed Matt Gaetz as attorney general and isolationist Tulsi Gabbard as director of national intelligence.

title: French court orders Google to halt news search results scheme
summary: In the latest battle between the tech giant and a French media union, a Paris court has ordered Google not to remove from search results some articles from media with which it was clashing over rights for use of online news.
